prerequisites: Prerequisite: Biology 125 and 126 and at least one upper-level Biology course releated to ecology, evolution or organismal biology
summary: Designed to complement and extend Biology 307. This course emphasizes field research methodology, with emphasis on comparison on ecological characteristics among terrestrial habitats in Australia and New Zealand. Major topics will include design and analysis of experiments, as well as use of primary literature to inform research questions.
title: Australia/New Zealand Program: Ecological Field Research
